Package tools

Class MultiTool

  • java.lang.Object
    • tools.MultiTool
  • public final class MultiTool
extends java.lang.Object
    This tool class contains handy methods which don't belong somewhere specific.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class Description
      static interface  MultiTool.ConstructorExecutor<V>
      Interface that to execute some code to generate an object upon initialization of the constructor.
      static interface  MultiTool.SourceConsumer<S,​V>
      Consumer-like interface which includes the source.

      • fireActionEvents

        public static void fireActionEvents​(java.lang.Object source,
                                    java.lang.String command,
                                    int modifiers,
                                    java.awt.event.ActionListener[] als)
        Fires an ActionEvent for all ActionListeners in the array.
        Uses another thread for execution to lighten the load of the swing thread.
        Uses as time the current time stamp.
        Parameters:
        source - The source of the event.
        command - The command used for the event.
        modifiers - The modifiers for the event.
        als - Array containing the ActionListeners that need to be notified of the event.
        See Also:
        fireActionEvents(Object, String, long, int, ActionListener[])

        command - The command used for the event.
        when - The time when the event occured.
        modifiers - The modifiers for the event.
        als - Array containing the ActionListeners that need to be notified of the event.

      • fillZero

        public static java.lang.String fillZero​(int num,
                                        int len)
                                 throws java.lang.NumberFormatException
        Converts an Integer to a String, with zero's filled till the n'th position.
        If the length of the number is bigger than n, then the full number is returned.
        Parameters:
        num - The number to be converted.
        len - The length of the number + number of leading zeroes.
        Returns:
        The given integer converted to a string in base 10, and is left filled with zeroes such that the total length of the returning string is n
        Throws:
        java.lang.NumberFormatException
        See Also:
        fillZero(int, int, int)

      • fillZero

                                        int len,
                                        int base)
                                 throws java.lang.NumberFormatException
        Converts an Integer to a String, with zero's filled till the n'th position.
        If the length of the number is bigger than n, then the full number is returned.
        Parameters:
        num - The number to be converted.
        len - The length of the number + number of leading zeroes.
        base - The base to convert the number to.
        Returns:
        The given integer converted to a string in base base, and is left filled with zeroes such that the total length of the returning string is n
        Throws:
        java.lang.NumberFormatException

      • fillSpaceLeft

        public static java.lang.String fillSpaceLeft​(java.lang.String text,
                                             int len)
        Adds spaces to the left of the given text till the total length of the text is equal to the given size.
        If the initial length of the text is bigger than the given size, no action is taken.
        Parameters:
        text - The text to process.
        len - The target length of the text.
        Returns:
        The input string, left filled with spaces.

      • fillSpaceRight

        public static java.lang.String fillSpaceRight​(java.lang.String text,
                                              int len)
        Adds spaces to the right of the given text till the total length of the text is equal to the given size. If the initial length of the text is bigger than the given size, no action is taken.
        Parameters:
        text - The text to process.
        len - The target length of the text.
        Returns:
        The input string, right filled with spaces.

      • fillLeft

        public static java.lang.String fillLeft​(java.lang.String text,
                                        int len,
                                        char fill)
        Fills the given string on the left with the given fill character fill. If the initial length of the text is bigger than the given size, no action is taken.
        Parameters:
        text - The text to add the filling to.
        len - The target length of the text.
        fill - The char used for filling the text.
        Returns:
        The given text, left filled with the given char fill until the target length has been reached.

      • fillRight

        public static java.lang.String fillRight​(java.lang.String text,
                                         int len,
                                         char fill)
        Fills the given string on the right with the given fill character fill. If the initial length of the text is bigger than the given size, no action is taken.
        Parameters:
        text - The text to add the filling to.
        len - The target length of the text.
        fill - The char used for filling the text.
        Returns:
        The given text, right filled with the given char fill until the target length has been reached.

      • fillCenter

        public static java.lang.String fillCenter​(java.lang.String text,
                                          int len,
                                          char fill)
        Fills the given string on the left and right with the given fill character fill. The amount of added characters on the left and right side will differ at most 1 (so |#left - #right| <= 1), where #left <= #right If the initial length of the text is bigger than the given size, no action is taken.
        Parameters:
        text - The text to add the filling to.
        len - The target length of the text.
        fill - The char used for filling the text.
        Returns:
        The given text, left and right filled with the given char fill until the target length has been reached.

        Parameters:

        font - The used font.
        Returns:
        An approximation of the width of the string. Assumes normal English language as input string.

      • isNumber

        public static boolean isNumber​(java.lang.String str,
                               int base)
        Checks whether the provided string can be converted to a number.

        It is allowed to pass an empty or null string as argument. The result in this case will be false.
        Parameters:
        str - The string to check.
        base - The base of the possible number in the string. It must hold that 2 <= base <= 36.
        Returns:
        true if the string only contains numbers in the given base. false otherwise.

      • isNumber

        public static boolean isNumber​(char n,
                               int base)
        Checks whether the given character is a number in the given base.
        For the base must hold that 2 <= base <= 36.
        Parameters:
        n - The character to check.
        base - The base of the character to check.
        Returns:
        true if the given char represents a digit in the given base.

      • intPow

        public static double intPow​(double base,
                            int pow)
        Calculates the power of a base.
        Calculates the power significantly faster compared to Math.pow(double, double), but only accepts integer powers. Benchmarks compared to Math.pow(double, double):
        • 2.4 times faster for very small powers an bases (e.g. between -50 and 50).
        • 2.5 times faster for small powers and bases (e.g. between -10,000 and +10,000).
        • 2.5 times faster for medium powers and bases (e.g. between +-10,000,000 and +-20,000,000).
        • 2.6 times faster for large powers and bases (e.g. between +-1,073,741,823 and +-2,147,483,647).
        • 2.6 times faster for random powers and bases (e.g. between -2,145,338,308 and +2,145,338,308).
        • 5.7 times faster for very small powers and large bases (e.g. powers between -50 and 50, bases between +-1,073,741,823 and +-2,147,483,647).
        • 2.6 times faster for large powers and very small bases (e.g. powers between +-1,073,741,823 and +-2,147,483,647, bases between -50 and 50).
        Parameters:
        base - The base of the operation.
        pow - The power of the operation.

      • deepClone

        @Deprecated
public static <V> V deepClone​(V value)
                       throws java.lang.IllegalStateException,
                              java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException
        Deprecated.
        One should clone the array type specific to reduce the runtime significantly. This is because array creation via reflect is very inefficient since it uses native code, hence it cannot be optimized via the JIT. Moreover, a lot of cases are not supported.
        Makes a deep clone of the given value. If the value is an array, recursivly make a clone of each element and put them in a new array.
        Type Parameters:
        V - The type of the value to clone.
        Parameters:
        value - The value to be cloned.
        Returns:
        a clone of the value. This means that value != \return && value.equals(\return) will hold afterwards (assuming that the equals method is implemented correctly).
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - If the clone method could not terminate normally.
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - If the provided value does not contain one of the supported types.

      • deepArrayClone

        @Deprecated
public static <T> T[] deepArrayClone​(T[] objArr)
                              throws java.lang.IllegalStateException,
                                     java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Deprecated.
        One should clone the array type specific to reduce the runtime significantly. This is because array creation via reflect is very inefficient since it uses native code, hence it cannot be optimized via the JIT.
        Makes a deep clone of an array.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of the array.
        Parameters:
        objArr - The array to clone.
        Returns:
        A deep clone of the given array.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - If the clone method could not terminate normally.
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - If the provided value does not contain one of the supported types.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

      • calcHashCode

        public static int calcHashCode​(java.lang.Object obj)
        Calculates a hash code for the given object.
        This function will always return the same value in the following case:
        • If the provided object is not an array, then the provided object is equal according to the Object.equals(Object) contract.
        • If the provided object is an array, then these rules also also hold for each element in the array.
        • If the provided object is an array, then the order of the elements is equal.
        Parameters:
        obj - The object to determine the hash code of.
        Returns:
        A hash code for the given object.
        See Also:
        calcHashCode(boolean), calcHashCode(byte), calcHashCode(short), calcHashCode(char), calcHashCode(int), calcHashCode(long), calcHashCode(float), calcHashCode(double)

      • calcHashCode

        public static int calcHashCode​(boolean b)
        Calculates the hash code of a boolean.
        Differs from Boolean.hashCode(boolean) by increasing the distance between possible hash values and evades the value 0.
        The runtimes of these two functions are equal.
        Parameters:
        b - The boolean to calculates the hash code of.
        Returns:
        The hash code of the provided value.

      • calcHashCode

        public static int calcHashCode​(byte b)
        Calculates the hash code of a byte.
        Differs from Byte.hashCode(byte) by increasing the distance between possible hash values and evades the value 0.
        This function should only be used when the hash code of an array must be determined, as it is slower but reduces collisions.
        Parameters:
        b - The byte to calculate the hash code of.
        Returns:
        The hash code of the provided value.

      • calcHashCode

        public static int calcHashCode​(short s)
        Calculates the hash code of a short.
        Differs from Short.hashCode(short) by increasing the distance between possible hash values and evades the value 0.
        This function should only be used when the hash code of an array must be determined, as it is slower but reduces collisions.
        Parameters:
        s - The short to calculate the hash code of.
        Returns:
        The hash code of the provided value.

      • calcHashCode

        public static int calcHashCode​(char c)
        Calculates the hash code of a char.
        Differs from Character.hashCode(char) by increasing the distance between possible hash values and evades the value 0.
        This function should only be used when the hash code of an array must be determined, as it is slower but reduces collisions.
        Parameters:
        c - The char to calculate the hash code of.
        Returns:
        The hash code of the provided value.

        This function should only be used when the hash code of an array must be determined, as it is slower but reduces collisions.
        Parameters:
        i - The int to calculate the hash code of.
        Returns:
        The hash code of the provided value.

      • calcHashCode

        public static int calcHashCode​(long l)
        Calculates the hash code of a long.
        This function is equal to Long.hashCode(long).
        Parameters:
        l - The long to calculate the hash code of.
        Returns:
        The hash code of the provided value.

        The hash code of the provided value.
        See Also:
        calcHashCode(int)

      • calcHashCode

        Calculates the hash code of a double.

        This function should only be used when the hash code of an array must be determined, as it is slower but reduces collisions.
        Parameters:
        d - The double to calculate the hash code of.
        Returns:
        The hash code of the provided value.
        See Also:

      • addToMap

        public static <K,​V,​M extends java.util.Map<? super K,​? super V>> M addToMap​(M map,
                                                                                              Pair<K,​V>... entries)
        Adds the given entries to the map.
        This function is intended to be used in constructor initialization when passing a fresh map with initial values to the super class.
        Type Parameters:
        K - The class of the key of the map.
        V - The class of the value of the map.
        M - The class of the map to add to.
        Parameters:
        map - The map to add the entries to.
        entries - The entries to be added to the map. The first element of the pair contains the key, and the second element the value.
        Returns:
        The original map with the provided entries added to it.

      • addToCollection

        public static <V,​C extends java.util.Collection<? super V>> C addToCollection​(C col,
                                                                                    V... arr)
        Adds all elements of the given array to the given collection.
        This function is intended to be used in constructor initialization when passing a fresh collection with initial values to the super class.
        Type Parameters:
        V - The class type of the array elements.
        C - The collection class type.
        Parameters:
        col - The collection to add the elements to.
        arr - The array containing the elements to be added.
        Returns:
        The original collection col with the added elements in arr.

      • toIterable

        public static <V> java.lang.Iterable<V> toIterable​(java.util.Iterator<V> it)
        Creates an Iterable from the given Iterator.
        The returned object should be used as a 'cast-away shell', as it takes the input directly from the provided iterator.

        Example:
        Iterator it = ...
        for (int i : MultiTool.toIterable(it)) {
        ...
        }
        Type Parameters:
        V - The type of the iterator.
        Parameters:
        it - The iterator.
        Returns:
        An Iterable which returns the provided Iterator as iterator.

      • forEach

        @Deprecated(forRemoval=true)
public static <V,​C extends java.util.Collection<V>> void forEach​(C col,
                                                                       MultiTool.SourceConsumer<C,​V> action)
        Deprecated, for removal: This API element is subject to removal in a future version.
        Replaced by ArrayTools.forEach(java.lang.Object, java.util.function.Consumer)
        Executes an action for each element of a collection. Usage is identical compared to Iterable.forEach(Consumer).
        Type Parameters:
        V - The class of the value.
        C - The class of the collection.
        Parameters:
        col - The collection.
        action - The action that will be executed for all elements.

      • createObject

        public static <V> V createObject​(MultiTool.ConstructorExecutor<V> exe)
        Creates a fresh object from the given executor and returns it.
        This function is intended to be used in constructor initialization when passing a fresh object the super class.
        Type Parameters:
        V - The class of the value.
        Parameters:
        exe - The executor used to create the object.
        Returns:
        The value that was generated by the executor.

      • printStackTrace

        public static void printStackTrace()
        Prints the current stack trace on a different thread such that it can be used in swing-environments with short event-bursts without delaying the swing thread.
        Uses the default error stream to print the stack trace and the current thread to get the stack trace from.
        See Also:
        printStackTrace(PrintStream, Thread)

      • printStackTrace

        public static void printStackTrace​(java.io.PrintStream stream)
        Prints the current stack trace on a different thread such that it can be used in swing-environments with short event-bursts without delaying the swing thread.
        Uses the current thread to get the stack trace from.
        Parameters:
        stream - The stream that will be used to print the stack trace on.
        See Also:
        printStackTrace(PrintStream, Thread)

      • printStackTrace

        public static void printStackTrace​(java.lang.Thread thread)
        Prints the current stack trace on a different thread such that it can be used in swing-environments with short event-bursts without delaying the swing thread.
        Uses the default error stream to print the stack trace.
        Parameters:
        thread - The thread to print the stack trace of.
        See Also:
        printStackTrace(PrintStream, Thread)

      • printStackTrace

        public static void printStackTrace​(java.io.PrintStream stream,
                                   java.lang.Thread thread)
        Prints the current stack trace on a different thread such that it can be used in swing-environments with short event-bursts without delaying the swing thread.
        Parameters:
        stream - The stream that will be used to print the stack trace on.
        thread - The thread to print the stack trace of.

      • logStackTrace

        public static void logStackTrace()
        Logs the current stack trace of the current thread.

      • logStackTrace

        public static void logStackTrace​(java.lang.Thread thread)
        Logs the current stack trace.
        Parameters:
        thread - The thread to get the stacktrace of.

      • initLogger

        public static void initLogger​(java.io.File file)
        Initializes the default loggers.
        First creates a FileLogger and set it as default. Then creates a ScreenLogger, which will also load the fonts.
        Parameters:
        file - the file the FileLogger will log to.

      • boundsChanged

        public static boolean boundsChanged​(java.awt.Container c,
                                    int x,
                                    int y,
                                    int width,
                                    int height)
        Checks whether the bounds of the given container have been changed.
        Parameters:
        c - The component to check.
        x - The new x-coord of c.
        y - The new y-coord of c.
        width - The new width of c.
        height - The new height of c.
        Returns:
        true if at least one of the values has changed. false otherwise.

      • countWrappedLines

        public static int countWrappedLines​(javax.swing.text.JTextComponent txtComp)
        Counts the number of wrapped lines in the given text component.
        All credits go to: blogmeister at tech.chitgoks.com
        Parameters:
        txtComp - The component to count the lines of.
        Returns:
        The number of lines in the component, including wrapped lines. -1 if the document model was corrupted.

      • intersects

        public static boolean intersects​(int x1,
                                 int y1,
                                 int w1,
                                 int h1,
                                 int x2,
                                 int y2,
                                 int w2,
                                 int h2)
        Calculates whether two rectangles with their corresponding location and size intersect. Boundaries are included.
        Parameters:
        x1 - The x-coord of rectangle 1.
        y1 - The y-coord of rectangle 1.
        w1 - The width of rectangle 1.
        h1 - The height of rectangle 1.
        x2 - The x-coord of rectangle 2.
        y2 - The y-coord of rectangle 2.
        w2 - The width of rectangle 2.
        h2 - The height of rectangle 2.
        Returns:
        true if the two rectangle intersect.

      • toBytes

        public static byte[] toBytes​(long data)
        Converts a long to an byte array.
        Parameters:
        data - The input long.
        Returns:
        A byte array representing the given data.

      • longFromBytes

        public static long longFromBytes​(byte[] data)
        Converts an array of bytes to a long.
        Parameters:
        data - The input data. Must have a length of 8.
        Returns:
        An long from the bytes.

      • toBytes

        public static byte[] toBytes​(int data)
        Converts an int to an byte array.
        Parameters:
        data - The input int.
        Returns:
        A byte array representing the given data.

      • intFromBytes

        public static int intFromBytes​(byte[] data)
        Converts an array of bytes to an int.
        Parameters:
        data - The input data. Must have a length of 4.
        Returns:
        An int from the bytes.

        Converts an array of bytes to a short.
        Parameters:
        data - The input data. Must have a length of 2.
        Returns:
        A short from the bytes.

      • getPrimitiveTypeOf

        public static java.lang.Class<?> getPrimitiveTypeOf​(java.lang.Class<?> c)
        Returns the primitive type of the provided class, or null if the given class doesn't have a corresponding primitive type.
        Parameters:
        c - The provided class.
        Returns:
        The primitive type of provided class if it exists. null otherwise.

      • getBaseClassOf

        public static java.lang.Class<?> getBaseClassOf​(java.lang.Class<?> c)
        Returns the base class of a primitive type, or null if the given class it not a primitive type.
        Parameters:
        c - The provided class.
        Returns:
        The base class of the provided class if it exists. null otherwise.

      • getDefaultPrim

        public static <T> T getDefaultPrim​(java.lang.Class<T> c)
        Returns the default value for a primitive type. If the given class isn't a primitive type, then null is returned.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The base class of the primitive type.
        Parameters:
        c - The class of the primitive type.
        Returns:
        The default value of the primitive type, or null if the given class doesn't have a primitive value.

      • memToString

        public static java.lang.String memToString​(long mem)
        Converts the amount of memory to a readable value.
        Parameters:
        mem - The amount of memory.
        Returns:
        A string representing a readable amount of memory.

      • memoryInUse

        public static long memoryInUse()
        Returns:
        The total amount of memory in use by the JVM, in bytes.

      • maxFreeMemory

        public static long maxFreeMemory()
        Returns:
        The total amount of memory that can be used before running out.
